title: Wow, just got perma banned for no reason
body:
Ok I get it. if your team reports you. Even if you didn't break any community rules. The system will punish you. There is no human checking involved. You group with a group of 4 people, they all report you. The automatic system bans you.

To me that is broken. There needs to be some human interaction, especially if you are closing peoples accounts.

replies.body: Can you post your chatlog?

> [{quoted}](name=Overburn,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-09-23T07:34:02.564+0000)
>
> Can you post your chatlog?

Sure.

Now keep in mind  Kat and Nunu were a team. And Kat was a troll at the start by banning Mids declared champion.
When I started to say report them for inting, Kat was 0 6 and nunu was 1  15

Is this really offensive and extremely inflammatory? 

Game 1
Pre-Game
BV 4 Lyfe: lol he nominated zed, and you banned it
BV 4 Lyfe: Vamp why?
BV 4 Lyfe: I'm thinking vamp is a troll
BV 4 Lyfe: trolls do shit like that
In-Game
BV 4 Lyfe: no shame in losing to a better team
BV 4 Lyfe: dude, you cant get banned for banning a nominated champ

BV 4 Lyfe: HAHAHAHAHAH

Post-Game

Game two we had someone go afk 5 minutes into the game. So we couldn't remake.

Game 2
In-Game
BV 4 Lyfe: duo jg

BV 4 Lyfe: please report our afk

BV 4 Lyfe: this is a waste of time
BV 4 Lyfe: 65 speed boots
BV 4 Lyfe: lol dude, you are not lagging, you are playing very well
BV 4 Lyfe: sorry, don't believe you at all
BV 4 Lyfe: else I would see you lagging
BV 4 Lyfe: and you are not lagging
BV 4 Lyfe: hey I prefer to believe my own eyes

BV 4 Lyfe: poor loser
BV 4 Lyfe: lol zed is calling others trash
Post-Game
BV 4 Lyfe: told you we couldnt win with an afk
BV 4 Lyfe: dude, you can never win a 4v5

There's a few lines that stand out, but overall your attitude is negative throughout. Not to mention it doesn't look like anyone was actually inting (i.e intentionally) feeding in that first game, so you constantly going off at them for it is basically just telling them they're trash, which breaks plenty of community guidelines. The second game is tamer, but again you are negative and insulting throughout.

Would this have been a punishment on it's own with no history? Likely not. Does it break enough rules to push you over into a punishment with negative history and strong behavioural warnings (14 day ban) in your past? Clearly yes.

The punishment was not made in error, so it won't be revoked, but given the relative non-severity of the offence (still not ok behaviour and this is assuming the log is unedited) support _might_ accept a reduction. Given that perma is the end of the line and you've evidently had punishments prior to this that decision rests heavily on what your past offences were, how many there were, and how severe they were.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2018-09-24T05:49:43.207+0000)
>
> There's a few lines that stand out, but overall your attitude is negative throughout. Not to mention it doesn't look like anyone was actually inting (i.e intentionally) feeding in that first game, so you constantly going off at them for it is basically just telling them they're trash, which breaks plenty of community guidelines. The second game is tamer, but again you are negative and insulting throughout.
> 
> Would this have been a punishment on it's own with no history? Likely not. Does it break enough rules to push you over into a punishment with negative history and strong behavioural warnings (14 day ban) in your past? Clearly yes.
> 
> The punishment was not made in error, so it won't be revoked, but given the relative non-severity of the offence (still not ok behaviour and this is assuming the log is unedited) support _might_ accept a reduction. Given that perma is the end of the line and you've evidently had punishments prior to this that decision rests heavily on what your past offences were, how many there were, and how severe they were.

Really? Just a couple of lines that stand out. And that is enough to get an account perma banned. Yes the log is unedited. Why would I edit it?

I have put in two tickets so far, and so far have received two canned responses. It seems they don't actually have a look at the logs. Just go by the fact that other people reported you.

The system is open to abuse. Troll a game, see if anyone bites, like I did, then get you and your mates to report them. Bam you just instabanned someones account.

Yes about 3 months ago I did get a 14 day ban, but nothing since then. I have been a good boy. I have seen much much worse behavior than mine in games.

It seems Riot doesn't care about behavior in games. Just chat logs. Troll as much as you like, trigger someone, report at end of game, done.
hey, HEYYYYY, JUST AS you told them to ff15 such and such. Why cant you tell yourself to FF this game? As far as life goes, this is nothing. Take your own advice.

> [{quoted}](name=TheDemonEmperor,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=00030000000000010001,timestamp=2018-09-24T11:42:02.255+0000)
>
> hey, HEYYYYY, JUST AS you told them to ff15 such and such. Why cant you tell yourself to FF this game? As far as life goes, this is nothing. Take your own advice.

FF15 is because we had an afk. and the enemy team was obviously winning. I have heard many many people say ff 15. You have never said it?
This is not about the game; It is about how you should cope with the outcome. The ban is irreversible, either remake a new account OR, do something else with your time.

>Really? Just a couple of lines that stand out. And that is enough to get an account perma banned. 

I think you missed a rather large point there. If we're getting technical it's more than a couple, but it's not just about the explicit lines of chat, but also the atmosphere they create. I also said quite clearly that a log this is unlikely to get an account punished on it's own, but would require significant negative history to have accumulated.

>Yes the log is unedited. Why would I edit it?

Whether or not you did, I should think the reasons would be obvious and that some scepticism is understandable.

>I have put in two tickets so far, and so far have received two canned responses. 

Like I said, if you ask simple questions you will get simple answers. They use macros yes, they don't have all that much time to address each ticket, so if they check and a punishment is valid, they aren't going to spend much more time on that appeal. If you want more info reply to the ticket (don't create a new one) and ask for context.

>It seems they don't actually have a look at the logs. Just go by the fact that other people reported you.

Yes they look at the logs, they also look at your prior offences and any supporting chat logs leading up to your punishment. Sometimes punishments are a result of many cumulative small offences rather than one or two severe ones. The reform cards can't display more than 3 games and as far as I know have a time limit on them as well, so sometimes the reform card alone doesn't paint the full picture.

>The system is open to abuse. Troll a game, see if anyone bites, like I did, then get you and your mates to report them. Bam you just instabanned someones account.

Clearly you have no qualms about being an ass in game, so it shouldn't really surprise you when that comes back to bite you. Retaliation is a no go, as you are responsible for *your* behaviour, and furthering the negative experience created by another player is just as bad as starting it in the first place. In your case the punishment is more than likely linked to *consistency*, not *severity*.

>Yes about 3 months ago I did get a 14 day ban, but nothing since then.

With time *and* good behaviour your punishment tier drops, but even if you don't display behaviour severe enough to see punishment, negative behaviour will still prevent your punishment tier from dropping.

>I have seen much much worse behavior than mine in games.

Your are responsible for your behaviour, not the behaviour of others.

>It seems Riot doesn't care about behavior in games. Just chat logs. 

Gameplay offences are harder to confirm (intent feeding vs a bad game and such), so they take longer to punish. This doesn't mean they aren't punished, nor does it mean chat offences should be ignored int he meantime.

Awwww! This is nothing!
Give him his account back, ffs.

> [{quoted}](name=kaboomblah,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-24T05:54:20.660+0000)
>
> Awwww! This is nothing!
> Give him his account back, ffs.

Thank you. In the same game I had someone in the game call me a fuckin shithead.

And yes they were inting, cait doesn't go 0 6 with a support who goes 1 15, unless they are inting.

I have seen much much worse, in my games I didn't report.

Yeah, look, I have two trains of thought.

A: You've been shafted. Like, if you said that stuff to me in game, it wouldn't even register. It sounds like you were a bit salty/frustrated. But how is that bannable? OMG, you called someone a "coward" and you got frustrated that someone was AFK/inting!!! I wouldn't be happy if someone had to pick up their kids mid-game. I'd 100% tell him to think before queuing next time.

B: You've been a right POS in the past and Riot has just gone, "Fuckin' get rid of this guy."

Did you have a history of KYS, hate-speech and other mega-ultra-intolerable stuff?

Honestly, the stuff you said in your chat logs? I reckon I say a lot worse. I still haven't received anything besides a chat restriction from about a year ago.

> [{quoted}](name=kaboomblah,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-24T08:45:39.868+0000)
>

> 
> A: You've been shafted. Like, if you said that stuff to me in game, it wouldn't even register. It sounds like you were a bit salty/frustrated. But how is that bannable? OMG, you called someone a "coward" and you got frustrated that someone was AFK/inting!!! I wouldn't be happy if someone had to pick up their kids mid-game. I'd 100% tell him to think before queuing next time.
> 
> B: You've been a right POS in the past and Riot has just gone, "Fuckin' get rid of this guy."
> 
> Did you have a history of KYS, hate-speech and other mega-ultra-intolerable stuff?
> 
> Honestly, the stuff you said in your chat logs? I reckon I say a lot worse. I still haven't received anything besides a chat restriction from about a year ago.

Shit no, I have never used KYS, never used any racial slurs. Hell I never even use the F, C, or N word.  LOL I don't even say shit in game. 

I have already lost one account due to this crap. And now am very careful, The logs I have posted here are as bad as it gets. I don't say ff 15 every game, only games where we have an afk, or people are obviously inting. I have been in many games where other people have suggested ff 15. Did I report them after the game? No because sometimes ff 15 is obvious.

Actually I think there is a group of players who do this for laughs, they go into a game and deliberately try and trigger other players. If the other players become negative at all, Bam, they all report that person, like what happened to me.

And the banning system is automatic. Get enough reports, and you get punished automatically.

I don't really care about this game now. I am going to make a new account. This account is going to be the one who steals the JG buff when leashing, the sup who steals your CS, the JG who never ganks, the top lane who never leaves top. I will not talk in game anymore, so without a chat log I can't get banned. But if another player is negative to me at all. I will report them.

Yeah I get banned for that chat log. I just had a game where our Darius said.

Im not feeding you little migrant fuckwit.
go neck yourself.
2 of them are because of you you stupid nip.
neck up kid.
you dying would be pretty usefull.
bunch of illegal immigrants who need to fuck off to your boat and drown.

I report him for toxic and racist. I get no message that my report resulted in a punishment.

The feedback popup is notoriously limited and rather unreliable. Not receiving one does not by any stretch mean no punishment was issued. It just means you didn't meet the strict (and imo sometimes quite arbitrary) criteria to receive the notification.

The behaviour of other players does not excuse your own.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=000300000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-25T04:06:59.100+0000)
>
> The feedback popup is notoriously limited and rather unreliable. Not receiving one does not by any stretch mean no punishment was issued. It just means you didn't meet the strict (and imo sometimes quite arbitrary) criteria to receive the notification.
> 
> The behaviour of other players does not excuse your own.

No, its more like I thought. A single report will result in no punishment. It won't even get looked at. But if a group of organized players all report the same person, the system will automatically issue a punishment, no matter what. As what happened in my case.

Taken from their own FAQ

Suspensions due to the Instant Feedback System will not be lifted or shortened under any circumstance.

So the instant feedback system can be used to perma ban accounts. If you are with a group of people who are playing bad, and you point out they are playing bad. They all report you, and the instant feedback system will permaban you. No human involvement needed.

That's what just happened to me. Our bot lane was inting. Mid was inting. I was doing well up top. I pointed out they were inting, they got shitty and all reported me at the end of the game.

The automatic system then perma banned my account, even tho I had done nothing wrong. All it takes is enough people to report you.

Your post is pretty much every single woe-is-me post ever posted on OCE Boards.

You are full of shit. You did not say, "Sir, kindly stop making it difficult for me to help us all achieve victory. Perhaps you could play a bit more carefully? Thank you."

You said something along the lines of: "You fuckin' feeding POS. KYS."

> [{quoted}](name=kaboomblah,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-09-23T04:45:23.085+0000)
>

>

> 
> You said something along the lines of: "You fuckin' feeding POS. KYS."

LOL I did not swear. Although I did say "please report our bot for inting"
That was about as bad as I got.
Bot took offence to that and reported me.

That's wholly not how the system works. Number of reports is irrelevant, only number of *valid* reports matters. You could be reported by 1 player or 9, and if you haven't done anything wrong you will not be punished. False positives aren't impossible, but they are *very* rare, and no-one will be particularly inclined to believe your innocence unless you post your reform card with what you were punished for.

To receive a permanent suspension, you more than likely have received at least one previous punishment. Unless you were banned for cheating, chargebacks, or account security (compromise and such), then the reform card you received upon being issued your 14 day ban explicitly stated that if the negative behaviour continued, your account would be permanently suspended.

Without your current reform card, there is no more that we can tell you.

If you wish to appeal your punishment, you can do so through player support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

Player support will only answer the questions you ask. If you ask a yes or no question, you will receive a yes or no answer.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-09-23T04:14:31.526+0000)
>
> That's wholly not how the system works. Number of reports is irrelevant, only number of *valid* reports matters. You could be reported by 1 player or 9, and if you haven't done anything wrong you will not be punished. False positives aren't impossible, but they are *very* rare, and no-one will be particularly inclined to believe your innocence unless you post your reform card with what you were punished for.
> 
> To receive a permanent suspension, you more than likely have received at least one previous punishment. Unless you were banned for cheating, chargebacks, or account security (compromise and such), then the reform card you received upon being issued your 14 day ban explicitly stated that if the negative behaviour continued, your account would be permanently suspended.
> 
> Without your current reform card, there is no more that we can tell you.
> 
> If you wish to appeal your punishment, you can do so through player support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
> 
> Player support will only answer the questions you ask. If you ask a yes or no question, you will receive a yes or no answer.

Actually I have proof the system is broken now. On my new account I just had a game. I didn't talk all game, actually I just ignored people. But I had a bad game I ended up 2 9 

So everyone decided they would report me. Before the end game lobby even loaded I had a screen telling me that a report against me for unsportsmanlike conduct was verified, and I was punished.

How the hell can a report be verified that fast? It cant be, so my point that the system works solely on the number of reports is correct. 

1 person can report someone who is racist, toxic, swearing, nothing will happen.

4 people report someone who has done nothing wrong, they get punished.

Only **one** valid report is necessary to trigger a punishment. If you demonstrated some for of negative behaviour, someone reported it, and upon review the report was deemed to be accurate, a punishment will be issued.

It is fast not because of the number of reports, but because of the nature of the system. That's why it's called the Instant Feedback system, and why there is an automated component. In cases where the automated system can identify and confirm the behaviour, it can issue punishments far faster than a manual review can (within 15 minutes of game end). That time-frame is a much more effective stopping measure, and makes it much clearer what the punishment has been issued for while the game is still fresh in the mind of the player.

False reports are meaningless. If you were punished, on one of your first few games no less, you were hardly a saint that game.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=r957Wyo4,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-09-27T04:09:50.104+0000)
>
> Only **one** valid report is necessary to trigger a punishment. If you demonstrated some for of negative behaviour, someone reported it, and upon review the report was deemed to be accurate, a punishment will be issued.
> 
> It is fast not because of the number of reports, but because of the nature of the system. That's why it's called the Instant Feedback system, and why there is an automated component. In cases where the automated system can identify and confirm the behaviour, it can issue punishments far faster than a manual review can (within 15 minutes of game end). That time-frame is a much more effective stopping measure, and makes it much clearer what the punishment has been issued for while the game is still fresh in the mind of the player.
> 
> False reports are meaningless. If you were punished, on one of your first few games no less, you were hardly a saint that game.

I didn't say anything. The whole game. I'm using this as proof that the system is broken. The system even issued the penalty before I hit the end game lobby screen. 4 people report me, bam instant punishment.

And no one report will not trigger a punishment. As I already pointed out, I have reported people for toxic abusive racist speach, and because I was the only one who reported them, they got no punishment.

>I didn't say anything. The whole game.

If so, you weren't punished for chat. If you were punished for chat, no-one is going to be particularly inclined to believe you unless you post logs.

>The system even issued the penalty before I hit the end game lobby screen.

It's possible it was for the game before in that case, but also possible you simply load into post game slower than other players. The reform card would have shed light on this.

>I have reported people for toxic abusive racist speach, and because I was the only one who reported them, they got no punishment.

No notification does not mean no punishment. You have no way of knowing if another player is punished or not. That information is not publicly available for many reasons.

The point of this post is, the system should not be fully automatic. There should be human people involved that actually look at the reports. I broke no community rules in the games I got punished for. All I did was get reported by a shitty team. That is not a fair system.
